content.description: A cool bouldery start leads to jugs and incredible huecos and pockets where a sit down can be found. Pull up into a tricky dihedral, make a tough clip and get ready to face your demons with a steep and beta intensive crux that goes from technical body positions to raw power.
content.protection: Stick clip. 5 Bolts to lower-off anchors.
content.location: Right of Holey Ghost with the huge hueco in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Steep and juggy on big huecos with a long reach to pull a spooky roof. Definitely a choose your own adventure climb. The trouble is that there are so many holes that it might be challenging to find the best ones. If you aren't grabbing a jug try again! Well bolted for introductory hero climbing with perma-draws.
content.location: Left-most route in this section of wall

content.description: This is a direct finish for Flight of the Phantom. Share the first 3 perma-draws and continue straight up through sinker pockets to two more bolts before the anchors. This is a good warm up for FotP and stays completely dry in a rain.
content.location: Shares start of FotP. Look for chalked up start jugs that get into a right facing dihedral.

content.description: This is everything you want in a route of this style. On the steepest wall at the crag, this line rides a prominent feature of amazing rock and hosts top tier power movements on great holds. Do not pass up a chance to try this climb! Stick-clip the first. Pull into a right trending dihedral to reach the first horizontal, campus left, clip the second and punch through to the next horizontal before embarking on a long rightward traverse. Jugs and a powerful move or two keep you moving up and right to an exciting crux, up high and with nothing but air beneath your toes. Fight hard or take flight.
content.protection: Stick clip. All permas to lower-offs.
content.location: Obvious line of right trending perma-draws on the right side of the wall.

content.description: This is the upper tier section of wall right of the Double roofs wall. It is easily recognized by the crazy pockets/huecos, and hosts the steepest route at the crag "Flight of the Phantom", which follows an impressive, right traversing prow with perma-draws.Note: Due to the amount of holes in the rock it is likely to encounter wasps in the warmer months. At the time of the FA's there were no nests present.
